ExampleDefinition.ToolTipDescription: Demonstrates a vertical chart with XAxis on the Left, Right, and YAxes at the Top. SciChart supports unlimited X and Y axis and allows placement of any axis on the Left, Right, Top, Bottom of the chart. Placing an XAxis on the left rotates the chart, giving a vertical chart effect.
ExampleDefinition.Description:
Demonstrates a vertical chart with XAxis on the Left, Right, and YAxes at the Top. SciChart supports unlimited X and Y axis and allows placement of any axis on the Left, Right, Top, Bottom of the chart.
The Vertical Chart is created by setting [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.Axes.AxisBase~AxisAlignment.html']XAxis.AxisAlignment[/url] = Left, and [url='http://www.scichart.com/documentation/v5.x/webframe.html#SciChart.Charting~SciChart.Charting.Visuals.Axes.AxisBase~AxisAlignment.html']YAxis.AxisAlignment[/url] = Top.
[b][i]Interactivity Options[/i][/b]
- Drag any axis to scale. - Drag the chart to zoom. - Double click to reset zoom.
